location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.84 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter with the following enclosures:1) A letter (f 229) from Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, to Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, dated 3 January 1852, discussing a report of seventy slaves landed at Mohemera [Khorramshahr] by a Hindu crew. Sheil doubts the authenticity of the report, requesting that enquiries be made to the Agent at Bassorah [Basra] on the issue;2) Letter no. 81 of 1852 (f 230) from Kemball to Sheil, dated 6 April 1852, reporting the Basra Agent's response to enquiries regarding the importation of seventy slaves at Mohumrah [Khorramshahr];3) Letter (f 231) from John Taylor, Acting Agent at Basra, to Hennell, dated 1 March 1852. Taylor reports that his intelligence suggests the rumours of seventy slaves being landed at Khorramshahr by Hindus are unfounded.
